questions.question: I am confident …………………….. you will win.
questions.description: We use that to introduce a noun clause.

questions.question: ……………………….. she read the letter, she started crying.
questions.description: As soon as is used to say that something will happen immediately after something else has happened.

questions.question: He took the tablet ……………………… the pain would alleviate.
questions.description: So that is used to express the purpose.

questions.question: …………………………. he is not interested, we will have to find someone else.
I visited a restaurant …………………….. they sell exotic seafood.
questions.description: We can use where to introduce adverb clauses of place.

questions.question: The soldiers fought bravely ……………………… the enemy was stronger than them.
questions.description: We use but to connect two independent clauses expressing contrasting ideas.

questions.question: He bit more ………………………. he could chew.
questions.description: We use than after a comparative expression.

questions.question: …………………………. I don’t get this job, I will be in trouble.
………………………… I get my raise, I will quit my job.
questions.description: Unless means the same as if not.

questions.question: The laptop ……………………….. I bought yesterday is very expensive.
questions.description: Both which and that can refer to objects in identifying relative clauses.
